New Records: Trae Young recorded 24 points and 20 assists in the game.
The Atlanta Hawks had seven players in double-figures.
Key Match Events: Trae Young hit a game-winning halfcourt buzzer beater.
The Hawks came back from a 15-point deficit in the first quarter.
Atlanta had a 14-2 run in the second quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: The Atlanta Hawks were on a three-game losing streak and were without Jalen Johnson.
Trae Young was the key player for the Hawks.
Utah Jazz had one of the worst defenses and high turnover rates.
Post-Match Reflections: Quin Snyder, the Utah Jazz coach, praised the team's effort.
The Hawks showed resilience despite missing key players.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Patty Mills came off the bench and made three three-pointers for the Jazz.
The game was played in freezing temperatures.
Others: Utah Jazz starting lineup: Isiah Collier, Collin Sexton, Lauri Markkanen, Johnny Juzang, Walker Kessler.
Lauri Markkanen scored 35 points and was crucial for the Jazz.
